text: The Cobra Mk IV is a multirole combat ship manufactured by Faulcon DeLacy, produced from 3301 to the present. It costs 764,720 CR with an insurance value of 38,236 CR. It is exclusively available to players who upgraded to Elite Dangerous: Horizons during its first year.

The Cobra Mk IV has dimensions of 33.1m x 48.1m x 8.6m and can accommodate 2 pilots. It has a hull mass of 210 t, armour rating of 216 with hardness of 35, shields of 125 MJ, and a heat capacity of 228. It has a cargo capacity of 34 t (default) up to 92 t (max), a fuel capacity of 16 t, and a mass lock factor of 8. Its manoeuvrability is rated 3, with a top speed of 200 m/s (default) up to 228 m/s (upgraded), and a boost speed of 299 m/s (default) up to 342 m/s (upgraded). Its unladen jump range is 9.44 ly (default) up to 24.91 ly (upgraded).
The Cobra Mk IV features 2 utility mounts, 3 small hardpoints, and 2 medium hardpoints. It has internal compartments including 2 Class 1, 2 Class 2, 2 Class 3, and 4 Class 4 compartments.

The Cobra Mk IV's default outfitting includes Pulse Lasers (L) on its medium hardpoints, rated F, Class 1. Its utility mounts and small hardpoints are initially empty. The ship is equipped with Lightweight Alloys bulkhead (I, Class 1), a Power Plant (E, Class 4), Thrusters (E, Class 4), Frame Shift Drive (E, Class 4), Life Support (E, Class 3), Power Distributor (E, Class 3), Sensors (E, Class 3), and a Fuel Tank (C, Class 4). Its internal compartments include a Shield Generator (E, Class 4), multiple Cargo Racks, an Advanced Docking Computer (E, Class 1), Supercruise Assist (E, Class 1), and a PAS (I, Class 1).
